QuoteText: Why not just do what FDR did in his own power grab? Threaten to increase the # of judges on the court so that you're guaranteed a majority. Then you can get the FBI to investigate all of your political opponents, have the IRS investigate them, and get them imprisoned for tax evasion. Really, there's a lot of ways to circumvent the normal limits of power, Clinton, JFK, and FDR did most of them. Read into their backgrounds and you'll see that if you want to get around the Constitution, there are plenty of ways to do so.
ResponseText: Thanks, great idea. Now the only obsticle in my way is getting elected president
Getting elected president would have been no problem a decade ago... Now you've got the dynasty to overthrow!

QuoteText: Getting elected president would have been no problem a decade ago... Now you've got the dynasty to overthrow!
ResponseText: Or at least the most insidiously ingrained duopoly ever created. They even act the same on fiscal issues - just spend, spend, spend. And make up election rules so alternatives cannot get a fair chance.
